intro: Hildegardia erythrosiphon subsp. erythrosiphon, commonly known as the red-lipped hildegardia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking red corolla lobes. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are clustered in racemes and are often visited by various pollinators. The subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is cultivated in botanical gardens for its vibrant floral display.
